about.title: Welcome to the MVP MPO Interactive Comment Map!
about.text:
Help determine the MVP for Transportation Metropolitan Planning Area Boundary!

Per federal code 23 USC § 134, the metropolitan planning area (MPA) must include at least the existing urbanized area (UZA) as defined by the U.S. Census Bureau and the contiguous area expected to become urbanized within the next 20 years. The Draft MPA Boundary displayed on the map meets these minimum criteria.

Use this Comment Map to identify areas where you think the Draft MPA Boundary should be expanded to account for:
  • Future residential growth (e.g., neighborhoods or areas where new residential development is expected)
  • Existing or future traffic generating destinations (e.g., business and commercial areas, recreational facilities and parks, community facilities such as schools and hospitals)
  • Improved continuity and connectivity of the transportation network and modes (i.e., public transit, driving, walking, biking)
Things to Consider:
  • The MPA boundary should be comprehensive enough to foster an effective planning process that ensures connectivity between different transportation modes, reduces access disadvantages, and promotes efficient transportation investment strategies.
  • You can see the locations and content of other people’s comments on the map. All comments will be compiled and shared publicly at the conclusion of this process. Names and contact info will be kept confidential.
  • The Comment Map is open for your feedback through April 28, 2023.

Thank you for your time and participation in the MPA boundary development process!

Visit the MVP for Transportation website Boundary Development page and FAQ to learn more.


Instructions

  1. Get Familiar with the Map:
    ØClick and drag the map to move around.
    ØUse the “+” or “-” buttons in the lower right hand corner to zoom in or out.
    ØClick the view options in the upper right corner to see different basemaps and layers.
  2. Submit a New Comment:
    ØClick on the “Add a Comment” button in upper right hand corner.
    ØFollow the instructions to “Click here to enter information OR draft the marker to adjust location.”
    ØWrite and submit a comment.
    ØComments will be hidden from other members of the public.
about.thanks: Thanks to Brian McBride and the great folks at FulcrumApp.
about.help: Watch Video To Learn More!

about.title: Welcome to the FNSB Roads Plan Interactive Comment Map!
about.text:
Help Create a Safer and Better-Connected Road System in the Fairbanks North Star Borough!

  • Use this COMMENT MAP to:
    • Share what you like or dislike about roads in your neighborhood and/or other locations in the borough.
    • Learn and share your level of support for what other community members like or dislike.
  • The COMMENT MAP is open for your feedback through the end of the year.
  • Your responses will contribute to an update of the Fairbanks North Star Borough (FNSB) Comprehensive Roads Plan.
  • THANK YOU for your time and contributions to the updated FNSB Comprehensive Roads Plan!
  • Visit the project website to learn more.

Instructions

  1. Get Familiar with the Map:
    ØClick and drag the map to move around.
    ØUse the “+” or “-” buttons in the lower right hand corner to zoom in or out.
    ØClick the view options in the upper right corner to see different basemaps and layers.
  2. Check Out and Respond to Others’ Comments:
    ØMake sure the box in the upper right corner has a check next to “Public Comments”.
    ØFind a comment you agree with/support? Click the “thumb up”.
    ØFind a comment you disagree with/do not support? Click the “thumb down”.
  3. Submit a New Comment:
    ØClick on the “Add a Comment” button in upper right hand corner.
    ØFollow the instructions to “Click here to enter information OR draft the marker to adjust location.”
    ØWrite and submit a comment about a safety, connectivity or other issue impacting your local/neighborhood roads.

Tell Us More

  • Take this short 10-minute survey to:
    • RATE the safety and connectivity of your local/neighborhood roads.
    • Share your ideas for the TOP 3 NEEDED CONNECTIONS.
    • Identify examples of "GOOD" or "POOR" quality roads in your neighborhood.

Fairbanks North Star Borough
about.thanks: Thanks to Brian McBride and the great folks at FulcrumApp.
about.help: Watch Video To Learn More!

Haines.name: City of Haines, AK Comment Map

about.title: City of Haines, AK Comment Map!
about.text:
Welcome to the Haines Borough Comprehensive Plan Revision Comment Map

We need more of your feedback, Haines! We’ve been listening and we want to get it right as we develop the revised Haines Comprehensive Plan. The revised plan will be a combination of long-term vision, goals, and practical strategies that will guide decisions about land use, transportation, utilities, economic development, housing, and more. It will provide a roadmap for implementation, with clear priorities and actions.

  • Check out what we’ve learned through the community survey, meetings, and other events.
  • What do you think? Do you agree with these suggestions? What are your ideas?
    • What do you want to preserve and/or change about Haines?
    • What are your land use, transportation, housing, economic development, utilities, or other priorities?
  • Use this Comment Map to tell us!
  • The Comment Map will close on December 31st.
  • Comments? Questions? Contact Project Team Manager, Shelly Wade, shelly@agnewbeck.com, 907-242-5326.
  • Check out the community survey results, snapshot, and other community input to date on the project website.

Instructions

Get Familiar with the Map:

  • Click and drag the map to move around.
  • Use the “+” or “-” buttons in the lower right-hand corner to zoom in or out.
  • Click the view options in the upper right corner to see different basemaps and layers.

Check Out and Respond to Others’ Comments:

  • Make sure the box in the upper right corner has a check next to “Public Comments”.
  • Find a comment you agree with/support? Click the “thumb up”.

Submit a New Comment:

  • Click on the “Add a Comment” button in the upper right-hand corner.
  • Follow the instructions to “Click here to enter information OR drag the marker to adjust in what location you want to add a comment.
  • Write and submit a comment about something you would like to preserve or change about that location, or other comments/questions.

about.title: Welcome to the Kodiak Waterfront Plan Interactive Comment Map!
about.text:
Help Create a safe, efficient, and modern waterfront in Kodiak!

  • Use this COMMENT MAP to:
    • Share what you like or dislike about the docks, amenities, or services throughout the City's harbors.
    • Learn and share your level of support for what other community members like or dislike.
  • The COMMENT MAP is open for your feedback through the end of the summer.
  • Your responses will contribute to City of Kodiak Waterfront Master Plan.
  • THANK YOU!

Instructions

  1. Get Familiar with the Map:
    ØClick and drag the map to move around.
    ØUse the “+” or “-” buttons in the lower right hand corner to zoom in or out.
    ØClick the view options in the upper right corner to see different basemaps and layers.
  2. Check Out and Respond to Others’ Comments:
    ØMake sure the box in the upper right corner has a check next to “Public Comments”.
    ØFind a comment you agree with/support? Click the “thumb up”.
    ØFind a comment you disagree with/do not support? Click the “thumb down”.
  3. Submit a New Comment:
    ØClick on the “Add a Comment” button in upper right hand corner.
    ØFollow the instructions to “Click here to enter information OR drag the marker to adjust location.”
    ØWrite and submit a comment on conditions, needs, or other issues.

about.title: Welcome to the Matanuska-Susitna Borough Bike and Pedestrian Plan Comment Map!
about.text:
Help create a safer and better-connected bicycle and pedestrian network in the Mat-Su Borough!

  • Use this COMMENT MAP to:
    • Share what you like or dislike about paths, trails, and sidewalks in your neighborhood and/or other locations in the borough.
    • Learn and share your level of support for what other community members like or dislike.
  • The COMMENT MAP is open for your feedback through the end of the summer.
  • Your responses will contribute to the Mat-Su Borough (MSB) Bicycle and Pedestrian Plan (BPP).
  • THANK YOU!

Instructions

  1. Get Familiar with the Map:
    ØClick and drag the map to move around.
    ØUse the “+” or “-” buttons in the lower right hand corner to zoom in or out.
    ØClick the view options in the upper right corner to see different basemaps and layers.
  2. Check Out and Respond to Others’ Comments:
    ØMake sure the box in the upper right corner has a check next to “Public Comments”.
    ØFind a comment you agree with/support? Click the “thumb up”.
    ØFind a comment you disagree with/do not support? Click the “thumb down”.
  3. Submit a New Comment:
    ØClick on the “Add a Comment” button in upper right hand corner.
    ØFollow the instructions to “Click here to enter information OR drag the marker to adjust location.”
    ØWrite and submit a comment about a safety, connectivity, or other bicycle/pedestrian issue.
